author: Nick Wadhams
description: Ukraine Ambassador Olha Stefanishyna said her country is engaged in “positive” talks about buying Tomahawk missiles and other long-range weaponry, even after President Donald Trump signaled he didn’t want to send them to the country.
title: Ukraine in ‘Positive’ Talks with US on Missiles, Ambassador Says

author: Nacha Cattan
description: Elise Stefanik plans to announce her bid for governor of New York on Friday, according to people with knowledge of the decision, pitting her against incumbent Kathy Hochul in a state that hasn’t elected a Republican candidate to the position since 2002.
title: Trump Loyalist Stefanik to Challenge Hochul for NY Governor

author: Sarah Holder, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: Today on the Big Take: the US government shutdown has broken records — and its economic consequences could prove even longer-lasting.
title: How the Longest Government Shutdown Is Impacting the Economy

author: Erik Wasson, Jamie Tarabay
description: The US Congressional Budget Office, which provides analysis on the budgetary impact of legislation, confirmed Thursday that its systems were hacked.
title: US Congressional Budget Office Systems Hacked, Probe Underway

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: Both political parties are zeroing in on affordability as an election issue.
title: The ‘Jenga Tower’ Economy Is Emerging as a Diving Force in Politics

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A US judge ordered Trump officials to fully cover the cost of food-aid benefits for more than 42 million eligible Americans this month, rejecting an administration plan to only partially fund the program during the government shutdown.
title: Judge Orders US Officials to Fully Fund Food Aid Amid Shutdown

author: Laura Curtis, Josh Wingrove
description: The US is pushing forward on President Donald Trump’s pledge to pause a series of penalties aimed at China’s shipbuilding industry, a key concession in his interim trade pact with counterpart Xi Jinping.
title: Trump Plans One-Year Pause on Port Crane Duties, China Ship Fees

author: Josh Saul, Mark Chediak
description: Democrats campaigning on a promise to lower utility bills swept key elections in New Jersey, Virginia and Georgia this week, and all signs suggest skyrocketing electricity rates will be pivotal in US congressional midterms next year.
title: Election Shocks Underscore Power Bills as New Political Risk

author: Greg Stohr, Zoe Tillman
description: A divided US Supreme Court dealt a fresh blow to transgender rights, temporarily reviving a Trump administration policy that generally requires new passports to reflect the sex on the holder’s birth certificate.
title: US Supreme Court Backs Trump on Passport Sex Designations

author: Shirin Ghaffary
description: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman pushed back at the idea that the company would seek federal guarantees to reduce the risk of its AI infrastructure spending spree, one day after a top executive at the ChatGPT maker suggested there may be a role for the government to help finance the technology.
title: Altman Says OpenAI Doesn’t Want a Government Bailout For AI

author: Katia Porzecanski
description: Hedge fund manager Ricky Sandler, who threatened to move his $8 billion firm out of New York if Zohran Mamdani became mayor, is staying — for now.
title: Mamdani Critic Sandler Says He’ll Keep Hedge Fund in NYC for Now

author: Natalia Drozdiak, Gregory Korte
description: A top CIA official warned that an extended government shutdown could pose serious national security risks to the US, and that the foreign intelligence agency was already struggling to fund some critical operations.
title: CIA Deputy Warns Lengthy Shutdown Poses National Security Risks

author: Alicia Diaz
description: A bipartisan group of US senators is urging Hungary to stop buying Russian energy as that country’s prime minister, Viktor Orban prepares to meet with President Donald Trump in Washington on Friday.
title: Senators Hit Hungary Over Russian Oil Before Trump-Orban Meeting

author: Celine Castronuovo
description: A federal jury found a former Justice Department employee not guilty of misdemeanor assault over a viral incident in which he threw a sandwich at a Customs and Border Protection officer.
title: Sandwich Thrower Acquitted of Assault Charge in Viral DC Case

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: US President Donald Trump said he would visit India at the urging of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the latest sign of a possible thaw in a trade dispute that has soured the two countries’ relationship.
title: Trump Says He Plans to Visit India at Modi’s Invitation

author: Daniel Flatley, Patrick Gillespie
description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. bought Argentine pesos last month on behalf of the US Treasury as Secretary Scott Bessent tried to shore up the country’s libertarian leader before a pivotal election, according to two letters sent Thursday by Senator Elizabeth Warren.
title: Warren Confirms JPMorgan Bought Argentine Pesos for US Treasury

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Peru’s congress has declared Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum persona non grata, days after her administration granted asylum to a former prime minister who’s hiding in a diplomatic residence in Lima.
title: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum Is Declared Persona Non Grata in Peru

author: Kate Sullivan, Anna J Kaiser
description: Kazakhstan will join the Abraham Accords, two US officials said, a largely symbolic move as the US looks to inject new momentum into the initiative following a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.
title: Kazakhstan to Join Abraham Accords as US Seeks to Expand Deal

author: Stephanie Hughes
description: Ontario’s budget shortfall is forecast to improve on stronger tax revenues, though the trade war with the US is keeping the government cautious on its economic growth predictions.
title: Ontario Deficit to Shrink Despite Trade Turmoil, Slow Growth

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis
description: Prospects are swiftly fading on Capitol Hill for a deal this week to end the longest government shutdown in US history despite warnings of worsening flight disruptions and mounting concerns about food aid for low-income Americans.
title: US Shutdown Dealmaking Hits New Roadblocks as Tensions Flare

author: James Woolcock
description: Lucy Powell, Labour’s new deputy leader, said the UK government should stand by its election pledges in a sign of growing disquiet within the ruling party that Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is set to break a key commitment on tax.
title: Labour’s New Deputy Chief Warns Reeves Not to Break Election Vow

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: A conservative presidential hopeful in Peru is vowing a major change in policy representing the mining industry’s biggest fear: to revoke key exploration permits and redistribute them.
title: Top Candidate in Peru Vows to Revoke Key Mining Industry Rights

author: Pablo Mayo Cerqueiro, Aisha S Gani
description: A group of more than 260 executives at UK firms, including the chairs of mining company Anglo American Plc, challenger bank Revolut Ltd. and software firm Sage Plc, have called on UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves to revamp the country’s pension system to encourage more domestic investment.
title: Anglo, Revolut Urge Reeves to Fix Pension to Revive UK Markets

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang, Madison Muller, Naomi Kresge
description: Eli Lilly & Co. and Novo Nordisk A/S secured deals with the Trump administration to slash prices for their blockbuster weight-loss drugs in exchange for tariff relief and wider access for Medicare patients.
title: Lilly, Novo to Lower Obesity Drug Prices in Deal With Trump

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union took a step toward approving its massive trade agreement with South American nations, finalizing measures to protect farmers once the pact is adopted.
title: EU Finalizes Farmer Protections, Advancing Mercosur Trade Deal

author: Ruth Olurounbi
description: Nigeria is engaging with the US to find a “diplomatic” solution to rising tensions sparked by President Donald Trump’s threats of military action against Islamist militants in the West African country.
title: Nigeria in Talks With US Over Trump’s Military Action Threats

author: Maggie Eastland
description: Senate Democrats are pushing the Trump administration for more information on US efforts to prevent American private equity and venture capital firms from bankrolling advances by China and other adversaries in key technologies including artificial intelligence and quantum computing.
title: Senate Democrats Press Bessent on Oversight of China Investments

author: Allyson Versprille, Lucia Kassai
description: The planned cuts to US domestic flight capacity are set to give many travelers less than 24 hours to find out if their journey has been canceled, potentially creating more disruption to the air travel industry already buckling under the longest government shutdown in history.
title: US Airport Flight Cuts Expected to Kick in Early Friday Morning

author: Jan Bratanic
description: Slovenia’s government presented plans to grant more powers to police and prosecutors after a fatal attack triggered nationwide outcry over public safety and inter-ethnic relations.
title: Slovenia Gives Police More Powers After Killing Stirs Outcry

author: Souhail Karam
description: Rebels fighting for Western Sahara’s independence claimed an attack on Moroccan troops, signaling no let up after the United Nations indicated it was open to the kingdom’s plans to administer the disputed territory.
title: Saharan Rebels Claim Attack on Morocco Troops in Rebuff to UN

author: Michelle Kaske
description: New York City’s mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s promise to make the biggest public-bus system in the US free has investors of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s $17 billion of farebox bonds watching closely since that bus revenue is used in part to repay the debt.
title: Mamdani’s Free NYC Buses Complicated by Bond-Paying Pledge

author: Lyubov Pronina, Max Ramsay
description: Belgium has set a new year-end deadline to secure a budget for 2026, avoiding a government collapse for now but prolonging political instability in the country.
title: Belgium Delays Budget to December, Averting Government Collapse

author: Bob Van Voris, Patricia Hurtado
description: Donald Trump won an appellate ruling that will let him argue he should have had the opportunity to challenge his conviction in the New York hush-money case on immunity grounds in federal court.
title: Trump to Get Fresh Review of Immunity Push in NY Hush Money Case

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Swiss firms are eager to bolster their US manufacturing presence as part of the nation’s effort to persuade President Donald Trump to lower tariffs on its imports, his top trade adviser said.
title: Swiss Firms Look to Boost US Presence in Trade Talks, Greer Says

author: Alicia Diaz
description: Nancy Pelosi, the 85-year-old California Democrat and first woman to serve as US House speaker, said she’ll retire from Congress at the end of her term.
title: Nancy Pelosi to Retire From Congress After Nearly 40 Years

author: Michael Nienaber, William Wilkes
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz threw his support behind proposed European Union tariffs to shield the continent’s ailing steelmakers and reiterated his government’s commitment to securing steel production and jobs in Europe’s biggest economy.
title: Merz Backs EU Tariff Plan to Help Europe’s Ailing Steelmakers

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US is seeking United Nations support for a proposal to send foreign troops into Gaza to help secure the fragile truce essential to President Donald Trump’s broader peace plan.
title: US Promotes Gaza Force at UN to Back Trump’s Fragile Truce

author: James Mayger
description: The Supreme Court’s questioning of President Donald Trump’s use of broad powers to justify much of his sweeping tariffs leaves businesses that actually pay the levies facing months of potential uncertainty.
title: How Fresh US Tariff Doubts Will Play Out Among Trading Partners

author: Foster Wong
description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi told UK Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper their countries should strengthen strategic communication to stabilize ties amid rising global tensions, warning that their bilateral relations may risk backsliding.
title: China’s Top Envoy Urges Stronger Dialog With UK Amid Uncertainty

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany’s lower house of parliament stripped a far-right lawmaker of his immunity as part of a criminal investigation into alleged misuse of party funds.
title: German Far-Right Lawmaker Immunity Lifted in Funds Misuse Probe

author: Mirette Magdy, Abdel Latif Wahba
description: Egypt will get $3.5 billion from Qatar by the end of the year, with the Mediterranean tourism investment potentially paving the way for Cairo to unlock billions of dollars from the International Monetary Fund.
title: Qatar to Transfer Egypt $3.5 Billion For Mediterranean Tourism Site This Year

author: Gonzalo Soto, Alex Vasquez
description: Mexico’s lower house approved President Claudia Sheinbaum’s second year budget that outlines a 10.1 trillion pesos ($543 billion) spending and a slew of tax hikes to pay for social programs and infrastructure projects while trying to narrow the fiscal deficit.
title: Mexico’s Lower House Approves Sheinbaum’s Second Year Budget

author: Rachel Adams-Heard, Fola Akinnibi, Sophie Alexander
description: Advocates fear the move would increase the number of family separations.
title: ICE Contract Would Help the Police Track Down Immigrant Children

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Peru’s economic elite was expecting to hear from the top six presidential contenders on Thursday at an exclusive annual gathering for local executives, where tickets run up to $2,000 a person.
title: Peru’s Presidential Hopefuls Are Now Dodging Its Business Elite

author: Alberto Nardelli, Jorge Valero, Jenny Leonard
description: The European Union is privately warning that there’s little it can do in the near term to compel China to ease export controls on critical rare earths, a move that’s caused major disruptions for Europe’s industry, including auto and defense manufacturers.
title: EU Warns It Lacks Near-Term Power to Sway China on Rare Earths

author: Pius Lukong
description: Supporters of the Cameroon People's Democratic Movement (CPDM) hold the new campaign fabric bearings the image of Cameroon's President and presidential candidate Paul Biya, moments before the presidential motorcade passes through, in Yaounde, on October 1, 2025. (Photo by AFP) (Photo by -/AFP via Getty Images)
title: Cameroon’s Paul Biya, World’s Oldest Leader, Sworn in for New Term

description: Latin American leaders will discuss the Venezuelan crisis this weekend.
title: Trump May Be About to Show His Hand on Maduro

author: Ashleigh Furlong
description: AstraZeneca Plc can absorb the financial impact of its recent deal with the US next year as demand for innovative medicines makes up for reduced prices in the world’s biggest pharma market, according to its chief financial officer.
title: AstraZeneca Can Absorb Impact of US Drug-Pricing Deal, CFO Says

author: Alessandra Migliaccio, Sotiris Nikas
description: When Umberto Dulizia decided to be a nurse twenty years ago, he never thought he’d struggle to make ends meet.
title: Southern Europe Seeks to Boost Middle Class After Years of Pain

author: Georgia Hall
description: The big money doesn’t want to wait until 2026.
title: Rich Donors Bankroll Redistricting Fights Ahead of 2026 Elections

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: Lackluster attendance mars the high-level gathering ahead of the UN climate summit in Belém, Brazil.
title: Key World Leaders Skip Talks Before COP30 as 1.5C Goal Slips Away

author: Fumbuka Ng'Wanakilala
description: Tanzania’s violence-marred election drew stinging criticism from the African Union, which said it didn’t meet international democratic standards.
title: Tanzania Gets Rare African Union Rebuke on Violence-Marred Vote

author: Ani Avetisyan
description: Armenia received a cargo shipment through Azerbaijan for the first time in more than three decades, a major step toward reopening regional transport routes blocked by conflict between the two South Caucasus countries.
title: Armenia Receives First Freight Cargo via Azerbaijan in Decades

author: Loni Prinsloo
description: US President Donald Trump took fresh aim at two of Africa’s biggest economies, renewing his threat of an attack on Islamist militants in Nigeria and questioning South Africa’s role in the Group of 20 days before it hosts a global summit.
title: Trump Renews Nigeria Threat, Questions South Africa’s G20 Role

author: Jorge Valero, Stephen Carroll (Radio)
description: The European Union must provide a “credible” funding commitment to Ukraine in order to unlock fresh International Monetary Fund money for Ukraine, the EU’s economy chief has said, as the country’s lenders race to avoid a financing crunch in Ukraine.
title: EU Faces Pressure to Provide Credible Funding Plan for Ukraine

author: Lucy White
description: A Reform UK-linked think-tank has advocated for a huge cut in civil service headcount and a reduction in welfare benefits, the clearest sign yet that Nigel Farage’s party would pursue spending cuts before embarking on its populist tax reduction plans.
title: Reform-Linked Think Tank Pushes for Civil Service, Welfare Cuts

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: South Africa’s President Cyril Ramaphosa ordered a probe into how its citizens were recruited to fight as mercenaries in Russia’s war against Ukraine.
title: South Africa Probes How Citizens Ended Up Fighting in Ukraine

author: Robert Burnson
description: The Trump administration said that based on “further calculations” it has determined it can provide recipients of low-income food assistance about two-thirds of their usual benefits this month, not the 50% it earlier pledged.
title: Trump to Raise Food Benefit Payments After Calculation ‘Error’

author: Mark Bergen, Marissa Newman
description: With almost all of its citizens’ genes already sequenced in a national database, it’s the test case for an ambitious—and, to some, concerning—approach to public health.
title: The UAE Is Winning the Race to Sequence an Entire Country’s DNA

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Jihadists in Mali have choked off fuel supplies to the capital, Bamako, threatening the junta’s grip on power and exposing the limits of Russia’s promised security support.
title: Fuel Blockade Threatens Mali’s Junta, Exposes Russia’s Limits

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Rachel Reeves stands to be the biggest beneficiary of her own efforts to bring down UK inflation and help with the cost of living in this month’s budget — but only if she gets it right.
title: Reeves Sees Reward in Keeping Lid on UK Inflation in Budget

author: Nariman Gizitdinov
description: President Donald Trump will host a summit with five central Asian countries as the US steps up competition for influence in the vast energy- and mineral-rich region where China and Russia have long held sway.
title: Trump to Host Central Asia Leaders as Race for Resources Hots Up

author: Erica Yokoyama, Keiko Ujikane
description: One of Japan’s largest labor union groups said it plans to target the same level of wage gains for regular workers in next year’s pay negotiations as it did for this year, as the Bank of Japan closely scrutinizes the momentum for wage growth.
title: Major Japan Union Group Seeks 6% Wage Hike as BOJ Watches

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korea condemned recent US sanctions imposed on its bankers, characterizing them as proof of US hostility and warning that such pressure won’t help resume dialogue between the two nations.
title: North Korea Says US Sanctions Won’t Bring Pyongyang to Dialogue

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan’s ruling party aims to secure roughly ¥1 trillion ($6.5 billion) per year to keep supporting the nation’s semiconductor and artificial intelligence sectors, according to a lawmaker who leads such efforts.
title: Japan’s Ruling Party Eyes $6.5 Billion Per Year for Chips, AI

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: Jamie Dimon said $20 billion in potential private-sector financing for Argentina “may not be necessary,” according to a Reuters interview with the JPMorgan Chase & Co. chief executive officer.
title: Dimon Sees Less Need for $20 Billion Loan to Argentina: Reuters

author: Shawn Donnan, Daniel Flatley, Laura Curtis, Mark Niquette
description: President Donald Trump’s use of broad powers to impose his signature tariffs faced a barrage of skeptical questions at the Supreme Court on Wednesday that signal it may be ready to intervene.
title: Supreme Court's Skepticism on Trump Tariffs Means Uncertainty Reigns

author: Sakura Murakami, Akemi Terukina
description: A Bank of Japan move to raise interest rates at a time when the government is calling on companies to invest more would likely send a mixed message on policy, according to the leader of Japan’s ruling coalition partner.
title: Japan’s Ruling Bloc Partner Warns Against Mixed-Message BOJ Hike

author: Swati Gupta
description: Millions of voters in India’s poorest state head to the polls Thursday in a contest seen as a barometer of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s support after his tumultuous year in office.
title: India’s Poorest State Goes to Polls in Test of Modi’s Strength

author: Shruti Singh
description: Chicago had its credit outlook lowered one notch to negative by S&P Global Ratings on Wednesday after Mayor Brandon Johnson proposed a partial supplemental pension contribution next year as the city grapples with back-to-back deficits and weaker reserves.
title: Chicago Outlook Cut One Notch by S&P on Deficits, Pension Woes

author: James Woolcock
description: The UK’s biggest business lobby warned Rachel Reeves against hitting companies with a series of smaller tax rises as she prepares this year’s budget, saying she should “prioritize long-term prosperity over short-term thinking.”
title: UK Business Warns Against ‘Death by a Thousand Taxes’ at Budget
